page.title: 10MAPPERCOMBE MANOR
page.content: Mappercombe Manor is surrounded by buildings and fields and is owned at the moment by{Admiral Sir V.A. {Crutchley V.C.}It's roughly 2km from Loders and you can get a good view from the old railway. The Manor was built on a 'Monastic Road' as a rest house, unfortunately the age is not known. There are two chapels on the Manor, one is now a cider house the other is a dressing room. The Manor was enlarged in the early 20th century. In the garden there is a pump dated 1907, there is also a sundial dated around the same time. The pump collects water from the Manor's gutters which is then used to water the huge garden which contains a large fig tree. In one part of the garden there is a swimming pool on the site of a monk's fish pool which is filled by a natural spring!
